thread.title: Gossip: Costa, Griezmann, Fabregas, Bellerin, Gabbiadini, Keane, - BBC Sport
thread.title_full: Gossip: Costa, Griezmann, Fabregas, Bellerin, Gabbiadini, Keane, - BBC Sport

title: Gossip: Costa, Griezmann, Fabregas, Bellerin, Gabbiadini, Keane, - BBC Sport
text:
Read more about sharing. 
For the latest gossip and debate, check out our Sportsday rolling news service every weekday, and for a list of all the completed deals, see our transfers page 
Chelsea rejected a £90m offer from Chinese Super League club Tianjin Quanjian for striker Diego Costa in January. The bid would have made Costa, 28, the second most expensive player in the world behind Paul Pogba. (Daily Mail) 
The brother of Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann has sparked more transfer speculation after a string of tweets during Manchester United's EFL Cup final win against Southampton. (Daily Express) 
Arsenal defender Hector Bellerin, 21, will reject a move to Barcelona in favour of joining Manchester City. (Daily Star) 
AC Milan will revive their interest in Chelsea's Cesc Fabregas, 29, this summer. The midfielder was strongly linked with a move away from Stamford Bridge in January. (Metro) 
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says player power is not to blame for Claudio Ranieri's sacking and that misguided owners are at fault. (Daily Mirror) 
Southampton manager Claude Puel has called for video technology after a Manolo Gabbiadini effort was disallowed for offside in Sunday's EFL Cup final against Manchester United. (Daily Telegraph) 
Arsenal are keen on signing 16-year-old Manchester City forward Jadon Sancho, who has 11 goals from 13 games for the England U16 and U17s. (Daily Mirror) 
Torino manager Sinisa Mihajlovic says Leicester City players should be forced to play without a manager if they did play a part in Claudio Ranieri's sacking. (Daily Mirror) 
Burnley are planning a £3m summer move for highly rated Mainz defender Giulio Donati, 27. (Sun) The Times lead with Zlatan Ibrahimovic and how he has proved his doubters wrong since joining Manchester United 
Manager Jose Mourinho wants to bring in two or three players this summer to take the 'next step' with Manchester United next season. (Irish Independent) 
Nantes manager Sergio Conceicao, 42, has turned down the opportunity to become Leicester City's new manager. (Sun) 
Everton are set to make a £28m bid for Burnley defender Michael Keane. The 24-year-old, who is also a target for Chelsea, scored in Saturday's 1-1 draw with Hull City. (Daily Star) 
Liverpool fans are hopeful they will sign Southampton's Manolo Gabbiadini, 25, after the striker scored two goals against Manchester United in the EFL Cup final. (TalkSport) 
Former Crystal Palace midfielder Sasa Curcic believes the Eagles' new signing Luka Milivojevic is the Premier League's next Luka Modric. (Croydon Advertiser) The Daily Star say Jose Mourinho wants to give Zlatan Ibrahimovic a new contract after his heroics in Sunday's EFL Cup final Best of social media This content will not work on your device, please check Javascript and cookies are enabled or update your browser And finally 
Roberto Mancini, one of the favourites to replace Claudio Ranieri as Leicester City manager, seemed unfazed by the speculation as he appeared on the Italian equivalent of Strictly Come Dancing. (Daily Mail) Share this page
